ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you want to learn about different approaches to study enzymes on a structural and energetical level, then this class is right for you.

Very useful course, with a nice overview of many different aspects of enzymology including relevant research methods. If you want to go deep into the most relevant literature in the field, this is definitely the way to go.
I would recommend this course to another student because I feel that it was a well-balanced course on chemistry, biology, biophysical chemistry, and biochemistry.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course introduced me to important practical tools and methods necessary to study kinetic and thermodynamic properties of enzymes. The course also helped me to advance my research reading skills. Most importantly, the course introduced me and sparked my interest in many topics/phenomena I had not been aware of previously.
I acquired a deeper understanding of transition state theory.
